CssAtDirective.name: font-face
CssAtDirective.description: Allows for linking to fonts that are automatically activated when needed. This permits authors to work around the limitation of 'web-safe' fonts, allowing for consistent rendering independent of the fonts available in a given user's environment.

CssProperty.name: font-family
CssProperty.description: Defines the font family name that will be used in all CSS font family name matching.

specifies the resource containing font data. It is required, whether the font is downloadable or locally installed. It's value is a prioritized, comma-separated list of external references or locally installed font face names.

entry.description: TrueType font.
OpenType font.
WOFF font (Web Open Font Format).
Embedded OpenType font.
SVG font.
A local font name. If not found, it will be downloaded from a fallback source.

CssProperty.description: Range of Unicode characters supported by a given font. Initial value is U+0-10FFFF
Specifies weight of glyphs in the font, their degree of blackness or stroke thickness.

entry.description: Same as 700
Specifies the weight of the face bolder than the inherited value.
Specifies the weight of the face lighter than the inherited value.
Same as 400
Extra Light (Ultra Light)
Semi Bold (Demi Bold)
Extra Bold (Ultra Bold)
Black (Heavy)

CssProperty.description: The font-stretch property is used to expand or contract the horizontal width of the font. The change is relative to the normal width of the font as displayed by the browser.

Indicates the desired height of glyphs from the font. For scalable fonts, the font-size is a scale factor applied to the EM unit of the font. (Note that certain glyphs may bleed outside their EM box.) For non-scalable fonts, the font-size is converted into absolute units and matched against the declared font-size of the font, using the same absolute coordinate space for both of the matched values.
Allows italic or oblique faces to be selected. Italic forms are generally cursive in nature while oblique faces are typically sloped versions of the regular face.

entry.description: Selects a font that is labeled 'italic', or, if that is not available, one labeled 'oblique'.
Selects a face that is classified as 'normal'.
Selects a font that is labeled 'oblique'.

CssProperty.description: Specifies variant representations of the font

entry.description: Specifies a face that is not labeled as a small-caps font.
Specifies a font that is labeled as a small-caps font. If a genuine small-caps font is not available, user agents should simulate a small-caps font.

CssProperty.description: Specifies a prioritized list of font family names or generic family names. A user agent iterates through the list of family names until it matches an available font that contains a glyph for the character to be rendered.

entry.value: Cambria, Cochin, Georgia, Times, Times New Roman, serif
'Lucida Sans', 'Lucida Sans Regular', 'Lucida Grande', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', Geneva, Verdana, sans-serif
'Gill Sans', 'Gill Sans MT', Calibri, 'Trebuchet MS', sans-serif
'Trebuchet MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Lucida Grande', 'Lucida Sans', Arial, sans-serif

CssProperty.description: This property is a way to preserve the readability of text when font fallback occurs. It does this by adjusting the font-size so that the x-height is the same regardless of the font used.

entry.description: Do not preserve the font's x-height.

CssProperty.description: Shorthand property for setting 'font-style', 'font-variant', 'font-weight', 'font-size', 'line-height', and 'font-family', at the same place in the style sheet. The syntax of this property is based on a traditional typographical shorthand notation to set multiple properties related to fonts.

entry.description: The font used for captioned controls (e.g., buttons, drop-downs, etc.).
The font used to label icons.
The font used in menus (e.g., dropdown menus and menu lists).
The font used in dialog boxes.
The font used for labeling small controls.
The font used in window status bars.

CssProperty.description: This property provides low-level control over OpenType font features. It is intended as a way of providing access to font features that are not widely used but are needed for a particular use case.

entry.description: No change in glyph substitution or positioning occurs.

CssProperty.description: Kerning is the contextual adjustment of inter-glyph spacing. This property controls metric kerning, kerning that utilizes adjustment data contained in the font.

The value of 'normal' implies that when rendering with OpenType fonts the language of the document is used to infer the OpenType language system, used to select language specific features when rendering.

entry.description: Implies that when rendering with OpenType fonts the language of the document is used to infer the OpenType language system, used to select language specific features when rendering.

CssProperty.description: This property controls whether user agents are allowed to synthesize bold font faces when a font family lacks bold faces.

entry.description: Synthesis of bold faces is allowed
Synthesis of bold faces is not allowed

CssProperty.description: This property controls whether user agents are allowed to synthesize oblique font faces when a font family lacks oblique faces.

entry.description: Synthesis of oblique faces is allowed
Synthesis of oblique faces is not allowed

CssProperty.description: This property controls whether user agents are allowed to synthesize small caps font faces when a font family lacks small caps faces.

entry.description: Synthesis of small caps faces is allowed
Synthesis of small caps faces is not allowed

CssProperty.description: This property controls whether user agents are allowed to synthesize bold or oblique font faces when a font family lacks bold or italic faces.

entry.description: Disallow all synthetic faces.

CssProperty.description: For any given character, fonts can provide a variety of alternate glyphs in addition to the default glyph for that character. This property provides control over the selection of these alternate glyphs.

entry.description: Enables display of stylistic alternates.
Enables display of contextual alternates.
Disables display of contextual alternates.
Enables display of historical forms.
Enables display with stylistic sets.
Enables display of specific character variants.
Enables display of swash glyphs.
Enables replacement of default glyphs with ornaments, if provided in the font.
Enables display of alternate annotation forms.
Enables display of ruby glyphs. This value only selects a glyph for use in ruby text, it does not affect font scaling.

CssProperty.description: Specifies control over capitalized forms.

entry.description: Enables display of small capitals. Small-caps glyphs typically use the form of uppercase letters but are reduced to the size of lowercase letters.
Enables display of small capitals for both upper and lowercase letters.
Enables display of petite capitals.
Enables display of petite capitals for both upper and lowercase letters.
Enables display of titling capitals.
Enables display of mixture of small capitals for uppercase letters with normal lowercase letters.

CssProperty.description: Allows control of glyph substitute and positioning in East Asian text.

entry.description: Enables rendering of Hojo Kanji forms.
Enables rendering of JIS78 forms.
Enables rendering of JIS83 forms.
Enables rendering of JIS90 forms.
Enables rendering of JIS04 forms.
Enables rendering of NLC Kanji forms.
Enables rendering of simplified forms.
Enables rendering of traditional forms.
Enables rendering of full-width variants.
Enables rendering of proportionally-spaced variants.

CssProperty.description: Specifies control over which ligatures are enabled or disabled. A value of ‘normal’ implies that the defaults set by the font are used.

entry.description: Implies that the defaults set by the font are used.
Enables display of common ligatures.
Disables display of common ligatures.
Enables display of additional ligatures.
Disables display of additional ligatures.
Enables display of historical ligatures.
Disables display of historical ligatures.

CssProperty.description: Specifies control over numerical forms.

entry.description: Enables display of lining numerals.
Enables display of old-style numerals.
Enables display of proportional numerals.
Enables display of tabular numerals.
Enables display of lining diagonal fractions.
Enables display of lining stacked fractions.
Enables display of slashed zeros.

CssProperty.description: Specifies the vertical position
Determines how a font face is displayed, based on whether and when it is downloaded and ready to use.

entry.description: The font display policy is user-agent-defined.
Gives the font face a short block period and an infinite swap period.
Gives the font face an extremely small block period and an infinite swap period.
Gives the font face an extremely small block period and a short swap period.
Gives the font face an extremely small block period and a 0s swap period.

CssProperty.description: Determines whether the user agent may modify glyphs based on optical size.

entry.description: The user agent may modify the shape of glyphs based on the font-size and the pixel density of the screen.

CssProperty.description: This property provides low-level control over OpenType or TrueType font variations.
Modifies the color palette based on metadata embedded in the font or custom rules defined in an @font-palette-values rule.

CssAtDirective.name: font-palette-values
CssAtDirective.description: Defines a color palette and associates that color palette with a specific font. This allows a web author to select arbitrary colors to use inside a color font rather than being limited to the preexisting palettes inside font files.

CssProperty.name: base-palette
CssProperty.description: The base-palette descriptor accepts either a (zero-based) numerical palette index, or a string, which corresponds to a named palette.

CssProperty.name: override-color
CssProperty.description: This descriptor overrides or adds a color to the initial color palette represented by this @font-palette-values rule.
This property allows web authors to select whether emoji presentation or text presentation is used for certain emoji code points.

entry.description: User Agents can choose to draw a Presentation Participating Code Point in either emoji style or text style.
Code points are rendered as if U+FE0E VARIATION SELECTOR-15 was appended to every Presentation Participating Code Point.
Code points are rendered as if U+FE0F VARIATION SELECTOR-16 was appended to every Presentation Participating Code Point.

Code points are rendered in accordance with UTS51 as either emoji-default, text-default, or text-only, depending on the values of the Emoji and Emoji_Presentation properties for each Presentation Participating Code Point.
